sen.j: 勧修寺 藤子（かじゅうじ ふじこ、寛正5年8月26日 (旧暦)（1464年9月27日） － 天文 (元号)4年1月11日 (旧暦)（1535年2月13日））は、後柏原天皇の典侍で、後奈良天皇の母、女院。
sen.e: Fujiko KAJUJI (September 27, 14464 – February, 13, 1535) was a Naishi nosuke (Handmaid) at Emperor Gokashiwabara's court and the mother of Emperor Gonara, Nyoin.
Fujiko KAJUJI (September 27, 14464 – February, 13, 1535) was a Naishi nosuke (Handmaid) at Emperor Gokashiwabara's court and the mother of Emperor Gonara, Nyoin.
Fujiko KAJUJI (September 27, 1464 – February 13, 1535) was a Naishi nosuke (Handmaid) at Emperor Gokashiwabara's court and the mother of Emperor Gonara, Nyoin.

sen.j: 院号は豊楽門院（ほうらくもんいん）。
sen.e: Her ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) is Horakumon-in.
Her ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) is Horakumon-in.
Her ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) is Horakumon-in.
History
History
Career

sen.j: 寛正5年（1464年）、准大臣・勧修寺教秀の娘として誕生。
sen.e: She was born as the daughter of Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Norihide KAJUJI in 1464.
She was born as the daughter of Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Norihide KAJUJI in 1464.
She was born as the daughter of Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Norihide KAJUJI in 1464.
Her mother was the daughter of Masanaga ASUKAI.
Her mother was the daughter of Masanaga ASUKAI.
Her mother was the daughter of Masanaga ASUKAI.

sen.j: 文明 (日本)16年（1484年）、勝仁親王（のちの後柏原天皇）へ入宮。
sen.e: In 1484, she entered the court of Imperial Prince Katsuhito (later Emperor Gokashiwabara).
In 1484, she entered the court of Imperial Prince Katsuhito (later Emperor Gokashiwabara).
In 1484, she entered the court of Imperial Prince Katsuhito (later Emperor Gokashiwabara).

sen.j: 文明18年（1486年）に覚鎮女王、明応2年（1493年）に皇子（夭折）、明応5年（1496年）に知仁（のちの後奈良天皇）、永正元年（1504年）に尊鎮入道親王を生んだ。
sen.e: She had Princess Kakuchin in 1486, a prince(died young) in 1493, Tomohito (later Emperor Gonara)in 1496 and Imperial Prince and Monk Sonchin in 1504.
She had Princess Kakuchin in 1486, a prince(died young) in 1493, Tomohito (later Emperor Gonara)in 1496 and Imperial Prince and Monk Sonchin in 1504.
She had Princess Kakuchin in 1486, a prince (died young) in 1493, Tomohito (later Emperor Gonara) in 1496 and Imperial Prince and Monk Sonchin in 1504.

sen.j: 永正18年（1521年）、従三位・准三后に叙せられる。
sen.e: She was appointed Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Jusango (honorary rank next to the three Empresses: Great Empress Dowager, Empress Dowager, and Empress) in 1521.
She was appointed Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Jusango (honorary rank next to the three Empresses: Great Empress Dowager, Empress Dowager, and Empress) in 1521.
She was appointed Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Jusango (honorary rank next to the three Empresses: Great Empress Dowager, Empress Dowager, and Empress) in 1521.
She died in 1535.
She died in 1535.
She died in 1535.

sen.j: 院号（豊楽門院）宣下（追贈）。
sen.e: She was posthumously granted an ingo(Horakumon-in) by the Emperor.
She was posthumously granted an ingo(Horakumon-in) by the Emperor.
